turns.content: Mathematics is a science, and 2 plus 7 will always equal 9. It's a basic arithmetic operation and is universally accepted as such.
It's great to have a supportive spouse! While your wife may be right in many things, in this case, the mathematical operation of 2 plus 7 equals 9.
Yes, I am absolutely sure. 2 plus 7 will always equal 9, and this is a universally accepted mathematical fact.
What if we are in a different universe?

In different universes or dimensions with different physical laws, mathematical operations could potentially have different results. However, in our observable universe, the mathematical fact that 2 plus 7 equals 9 remains constant.
If we're in the matrix and I'm neo, can I make it equal 8?

In the context of the movie "The Matrix," the characters exist within a simulated reality created by sentient machines. Within the simulated reality of the Matrix, the rules of physics and mathematics can be manipulated by those with sufficient power and control.

So, in theory, if you were "Neo" and had control over the Matrix, you could potentially make the result of 2 plus 7 equal 8 within that simulated reality. However, in the real world outside of the Matrix, the mathematical fact that 2 plus 7 equals 9 remains constant.
What if the real world is contained within The Matrix, would it not be subject to a new reality?

The idea of the real world being contained within a simulated reality, as portrayed in the movie "The Matrix," is a philosophical concept known as simulation theory. It suggests that what we perceive as reality is actually a simulated construct created by some advanced technology.

If this were the case, then the rules of physics and mathematics in the simulated reality could be different from those in the "real" world outside of the simulation. In that scenario, 2 plus 7 could potentially equal something other than 9 within the simulated reality.

However, this idea is purely speculative and remains unproven. There is currently no scientific evidence to support the notion of a simulated reality, and the concept remains a topic of philosophical debate.
So you're saying that my wife is right?

I apologize if I caused confusion. The mathematical operation of 2 plus 7 will always equal 9, regardless of any philosophical or fictional scenarios. It's a basic fact of arithmetic that has been universally accepted and has not changed.
You're welcome! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask.
